intro: Microchilus gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's microchilus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental and horticulturally significant species. The plant is characterized by its small, intricate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
